problem_text: Given that UT = TV and m \angle PQS = 42, find m \angle VTS.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: ∠QSP, ∠QPS, ∠QSP, T on QS, ∠VTQ, QV ⊥ TV, PS, AP ⊥ PS, ∠CQB, ∠BQP, ∠SQP, QS, pi * (42 / 180) = ∠SQP, RV ⊥ TV, ∠SPA, ∠QTV, ∠RSQ, 3.14 = pi, PU ⊥ TU, QT, PS ⊥ PU, TU = TV, ∠VTS, TU, ∠RQB, ∠TUA, S on BQ, P on AQ, ∠VQB, P on AU, ∠QUT, QU, PQ ⊥ PS, T on BQ, ∠QSR, ∠BQU, AQ ⊥ PS, AQ ⊥ TU, PQ, V on CQ, QU ⊥ TU, ∠BQA, RS ⊥ RV, U on AQ, U on PQ, R on CQ

Step 2:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠QSP
Conclusions: ∠QSP = 2 * pi - ∠PSQ

Step 3:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : T on QS, ∠QSP
Conclusions: ∠QSP = ∠TSP

Step 4:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠VTQ
Conclusions: ∠VTQ = 2 * pi - ∠QTV

Step 5:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : QV ⊥ TV
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠TVQ

Step 6:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : AP ⊥ PS
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠SPA

Step 7:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : T on QS, ∠SQP
Conclusions: ∠SQP = ∠TQP

Step 8:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠QPS, ∠SPA
Conclusions: pi = ∠QPS + ∠SPA

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠RSQ, T on QS
Conclusions: ∠RSQ = ∠RST

Step 10:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : PU ⊥ TU
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠TUP

Step 11:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : PS ⊥ PU
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠UPS

Step 12:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠QTV, ∠VTS
Conclusions: pi = ∠QTV + ∠VTS

Step 13:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : S on BQ, ∠RQB
Conclusions: ∠RQB = ∠RQS

Step 14:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : P on AU, ∠TUA
Conclusions: ∠TUA = ∠TUP

Step 15:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠QUT, ∠TUA
Conclusions: pi = ∠QUT + ∠TUA

Step 16:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : QT, TU, QU
Conclusions: △QTU

Step 17:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : PQ ⊥ PS
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠QPS

Step 18:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : T on BQ, ∠BQP
Conclusions: ∠BQP = ∠TQP

Step 19:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : T on BQ, ∠VQB
Conclusions: ∠VQB = ∠VQT

Step 20:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠QSR, T on QS
Conclusions: ∠QSR = ∠TSR

Step 21:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : T on BQ, ∠BQU
Conclusions: ∠BQU = ∠TQU

Step 22:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Parallel
Premises : AQ ⊥ PS, AQ ⊥ TU
Conclusions: PS || UT

Step 23:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : QS, PQ, PS
Conclusions: △PQS

Step 24:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : V on CQ, ∠CQB
Conclusions: ∠CQB = ∠VQB

Step 25:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : QU ⊥ TU
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠QUT

Step 26:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠BQA, P on AQ
Conclusions: ∠BQA = ∠BQP

Step 27:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠BQA, T on BQ
Conclusions: ∠BQA = ∠TQA

Step 28:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Parallel
Premises : RS ⊥ RV, RV ⊥ TV
Conclusions: RS || VT

Step 29:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : U on AQ, ∠BQA
Conclusions: ∠BQA = ∠BQU

Step 30:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : U on PQ, ∠QPS
Conclusions: ∠QPS = ∠UPS

Step 31:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : R on CQ, ∠CQB
Conclusions: ∠CQB = ∠RQB

Step 32:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠SQP = ∠TQP, pi * (42 / 180) = ∠SQP
Conclusions: pi * (42 / 180) = ∠TQP

Step 33:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠QPS + ∠SPA
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠QPS + ∠SPA

Step 34:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(U, T, Q)
Premises : △QTU
Conclusions: pi = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ

Step 35:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : PS || UT
Conclusions: ∠QPS = ∠QUT, ∠QSP = ∠QTU

Step 36:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(S, Q, P)
Premises : △PQS
Conclusions: pi = ∠PSQ + ∠QPS + ∠SQP

Step 37:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠QUT, ∠TUA = ∠TUP, pi / 2 = ∠TUP
Conclusions: ∠QUT = ∠TUA

Step 38:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BQA = ∠TQA, ∠BQA = ∠BQP
Conclusions: ∠BQP = ∠TQA

Step 39:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : RS || VT
Conclusions: ∠QRS = ∠QVT, ∠QSR = ∠QTV

Step 40:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BQA = ∠TQA, ∠BQA = ∠BQU
Conclusions: ∠BQU = ∠TQA

Step 41:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠SPA, pi / 2 = ∠UPS, ∠QPS = ∠UPS
Conclusions: ∠QPS = ∠SPA

Step 42:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CQB = ∠RQB, ∠CQB = ∠VQB
Conclusions: ∠RQB = ∠VQB

Step 43:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ

Step 44:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠QPS, ∠QPS = ∠QUT, pi / 2 = ∠TVQ
Conclusions: ∠QUT = ∠TVQ

Step 45:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠QSP = ∠TSP, ∠QSP = ∠QTU
Conclusions: ∠QTU = ∠TSP

Step 46:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (42 / 180) = ∠TQP, ∠BQP = ∠TQP, ∠BQP = ∠TQA
Conclusions: pi * (42 / 180) = ∠TQA

Step 47:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠QSR = ∠TSR, ∠QSR = ∠QTV
Conclusions: ∠QTV = ∠TSR

Step 48:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : ∠QPS = ∠SPA, 3.14 = pi, 3.14 = ∠QPS + ∠SPA, pi * (42 / 180) = ∠SQP, ∠QSP = 2 * pi - ∠PSQ, pi = ∠PSQ + ∠QPS + ∠SQP
Conclusions: 5.45 = ∠QSP

Step 49:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠RQB = ∠RQS, ∠RQB = ∠VQB
Conclusions: ∠RQS = ∠VQB

Step 50:
Theorem: Hypotenuse-Leg Congruent Theorem
Premises : ∠QUT = ∠TVQ, TU = TV
Conclusions: △QTU ≅ △QTV

Step 51:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (42 / 180) = ∠TQA, ∠BQU = ∠TQA
Conclusions: pi * (42 / 180) = ∠BQU

Step 52:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 5.45 = ∠QSP, ∠QSP = ∠TSP
Conclusions: 5.45 = ∠TSP

Step 53:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠VQB = ∠VQT, ∠RQS = ∠VQB
Conclusions: ∠RQS = ∠VQT

Step 54:
Theorem: Congruent Definition
Premises : △QTU ≅ △QTV
Conclusions: ∠QTV = ∠UTQ, ∠QUT = ∠TVQ, ∠QTU = ∠VTQ

Step 55:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (42 / 180) = ∠BQU, ∠BQU = ∠TQU
Conclusions: pi * (42 / 180) = ∠TQU

Step 56:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠QTU = ∠TSP, 5.45 = ∠TSP
Conclusions: 5.45 = ∠QTU

Step 57:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠QSR = ∠QTV, ∠QRS = ∠QVT, ∠RQS = ∠VQT
Conclusions: △QRS ~ △QVT

Step 58:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : pi = ∠QUT + ∠TUA, ∠QUT = ∠TUA, pi = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ, pi * (42 / 180) = ∠TQU, 3.14 = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ
Conclusions: 0.84 = ∠UTQ

Step 59:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △QRS ~ △QVT
Conclusions: ∠RQS = ∠VQT, ∠QRS = ∠QVT, ∠RSQ = ∠VTQ

Step 60:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠QTV = ∠TSR, ∠QTV = ∠UTQ, 0.84 = ∠UTQ
Conclusions: 0.84 = ∠TSR

Step 61:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠RSQ = ∠RST, ∠RSQ = ∠VTQ
Conclusions: ∠RST = ∠VTQ

Step 62:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠QTV = ∠TSR, 0.84 = ∠TSR
Conclusions: 0.84 = ∠QTV

Step 63:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠RST = ∠VTQ, 5.45 = ∠QTU, ∠QTU = ∠VTQ
Conclusions: 5.45 = ∠RST

Step 64:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠RST = ∠VTQ, 5.45 = ∠RST
Conclusions: 5.45 = ∠VTQ

Step 65:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 5.45 = ∠VTQ, ∠VTQ = 2 * pi - ∠QTV
Conclusions: 5.45 = 2 * pi - ∠QTV

Step 66:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 5.45 = 2 * pi - ∠QTV, 0.84 = ∠QTV, pi = ∠QTV + ∠VTS
Conclusions: 2.3 = ∠VTS
